newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Vietnam may scale down refinery project - paper.
newsitem.headline: Vietnam may scale down refinery project - paper.

text.p: Vietnam may scale down plans to build its first oil refinery at the controversial location of Dung Quat in the centre of the country, the Saigon Times Daily said on Tuesday.
"The adjustment aims at making the project smaller, but more profitable and thus more attractive to foreign investors," it said.

It quoted Ngo Thuong San, president of the state oil and gas firm Petrovietnam, as saying that the "corporation and concerned authorities have been considering the feasibility study of the project with the view to readjusting its goals and making them more realistic and more profitable".
The newspaper gave no details of how original plans to invest $1.3 billion for a 6.5 million tonnes per year refinery may be adjusted. Petrovietnam officials were not available to comment.
The refinery, which Vietnam says it desperately needs by early next century to cut a growing bill for petroleum product imports, has long been a subject of controversy.
